items.title: Agency staff covering for Birmingham bin strike vote to take industrial action
items.description: Unite say the staff are not crossing picket lines, due to intimidation at the council's refuse section.

items.title: Trump reverses position and urges own party to vote for release of Epstein files
items.description: "We have nothing to hide," the US president writes - a reversal after previously resisting publishing the documents.

items.title: School bans singing of KPop Demon Hunters songs
items.description: The head teacher tells parents references to demons can feel "deeply uncomfortable" to Christians.

items.title: Ukraine to import US liquefied natural gas via Greece
items.description: Vital supplies are due to start flowing from the Balkans as energy infrastructure faces sustained Russian attack.

items.title: British hacker must repay Â£4m after hijacking celebrity Twitter accounts
items.description: Joseph O'Connor, from Liverpool, hacked more than 130 accounts in July 2020 to promote a Bitcoin scam.
